text:
Decide on guest numbers at least two and half weeks before the party. Two weeks prior to the party, send out the invitations to your guests. Decide on drink ideas well in advance of the cocktail party. There are several possible ways to go about this:
Look online for suitable cocktail recipes (wikiHow has a great selection). Check out books for ideas. There is a great range of cocktail books available; your local library is a great source. Finalize numbers of the party one week before the event. Make sure that you can get all the ingredients for your drinks at this time and order in anything needed. Prepare the menu for food one week in advance. As with the drink ingredients, be sure that you can get all the ingredients prior to the event. Organize the layout of the location about three days prior to the event. Buy the decorations too! Purchase the ingredients for the drinks need this day or the next day. Food needs to be bought also. Today is also a good day to find your dress/clothes. Purchase non-perishable food ingredients. Prepare food items the day before or the morning before, as befits the recipes and keeping properties of the food.  Put everything out where it should be on the actual day. This day you will spend most of the time organizing last minute details and playing host.
